results.title: The Three A's
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Great Britain. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: One of the principles introduced into education in Great Britain as a result of the New Education Act of 1944 is that of stressing the three A’s rather than the traditional three R’s; the three A’s are - age, ability, and aptitude, of each individual pupil. By considering these three A’s, teachers and parents are better able to provide for each child the type of education most suited to their needs. The aim of education becomes the co-ordination of classroom and practical experience, so that children learn to apply their knowledge and skills to the demands of everyday life.

results.title: The Thomson River Dam
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service Productions and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: The dam that was built on the Thomson River in the Great Dividing Range almost doubled the capacity of Melbourne’s water storage as well as aiding in flood control. This is a record of its progress, including the environmental study and the relationship of the dam to downstream users. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: The Third stroke
results.creator_credit: Daniel Nettheim, Jonathan Green and Green Light Productions
results.brief_description: A bored, beautiful young office worker puts the timekeepers of the talking clock service to the test. In a tribute to the style and cinematography of film noir, this short film offers some comic relief and perhaps even a few explanations for those intrigued by the people behind the scenes in the customer service industry.

results.title: The Third side
results.brief_description: An archival exposition of the industrial processes undertaken by the various arms of EMI (circa 1950). Describes production methods of LP records and cathode ray tubes in some detail. Also outlines contemporaneous broadcasting technology and primitive audio tape recorders.

results.title: The Third pollution
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the principles of solid waste management and the problems of collecting and disposing of refuse, garbage and other solid wastes. Outlines various alternatives to the disposal of solid wastes, economically, while controlling air and water pollution.

results.title: The Third front: political theatre - Erwin Piscator
results.creator_credit: Peter Wyeth, Margaret Williams and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: Erwin Piscator’s work as a producer/director in the Berlin of the 20’s moved theatre away from the confines of domestic drama to the play of forces in world politics.

results.title: The Third dimension
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Introduces the idea of optical illusion, and the way it relates to our perception of depth in the two-dimensional image.

results.title: The Thief of Baghdad. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Gregstan Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
An edited version with commentary of the children’s silent classic adventure fantasy, “The Thief of Baghdad” made in 1924 and directed by Raoul Walsh. Features Douglas Fairbanks in the role of the thief.
